Office of the CEO Consultant III

•  Address and resolve elevated customer service issues and other service issues on behalf of Executive Staff and CEO.•  Review and collaborate on potentially sensitive items with GoDaddy Legal team.•  Author help articles for co-workers as featured guest writer for internal knowledgebase site.•  Compile content and delegate to teammates for departmental tip articles series on internal knowledgebase.•  Constructed internal site for standardized tracking of abusive/troublesome customers•  Worked with Law Enforcement/U.S. Government on special projects.•  Influenced and managed transition of major brand partner to new GoDaddy hosting platform, reducing technical issues by 84% (92 complaints to 15 year over year).•  Manage support for and maintain communication with influencers, including current and former GoDaddy celebrity spokespersons.•  Promote the GoDaddy brand, generate candidate leads at career events, and provide feedback as a Talent Acquisition Ambassador
Online Support Representative (Level 1 / Level 2), Sales and Support

•  Analyzed and resolved customer support concerns via email and GoDaddy support forums.•  Collaborated with Social Media team on customer support..•  Utilized multiple customer support platforms during GoDaddy’s launch of chat support, and support of acquired Outright customers.  Provided feedback to stakeholders.

•  Conceptualized, scheduled, and implemented on-air and off-air promotions for AC and Top 40 stations, including coordinating air staff and sales teams.  Assessed promotions post-mortem for effectiveness.•  Streamlined and simplified promotions process for both stations.•  Collaborated with graphic design firm in redesign of station sites, leading to 300% traffic increase.•  Organized and executed “Koncert for KISS Kids” concert featuring national, regional, and local music acts, with $10,000 proceeds donated to local children’s hospital.

•  Promoted established images of 3 different CBS stations at diverse events.•  Supported set-up and execution of major station events.•  Developed relationships with business clients.•  Achieved significant increases in ratings and time spent listening as night host on KZON.

•  Conceptualized and produced station imaging for WPVL and KIYX.•  Researched and performed daily afternoon show on WPVL.•  Trained, scheduled, and managed part-time staff.•  Promoted established images of radio stations at a number of events.•  Managed work and academic responsibilities, holding full-time professional position while pursuing education.
Also worked on annual student-run telethon to benefit Wisconsin Badger Camp, and helped raise over $60,000.  I have also returned as an alumni to help with telethons.

Mike Lyons is the best promotions coordinator I have ever had.  He is organized, self-motivated...awesome with listener/client interaction.Our website (www.959KISSFM.com) won a Wisconsin Broadcasters Association award for best radio station website.  Much of that has to do with the hours Mike poured into the project creating graphics and loading content.If you are looking for a person that you can trust to do the job right (and probably have it done before you even ask him to do it), Mike is your guy.

Content Creator | KXGE & WDBQ-FM Brand Manager; KLYV Afternoon Host (Townsquare Media) | Graphic Designer

You should really hire Mike.Oh, you wanted something more substantive?  Okay, then:Mike is quite simply the best promotions guy I've ever had.  I never had to worry about things not getting done.  I didn't spend a lot of time correcting errors or reminding him to take care of things.  He wasn't shy to bring ideas that would make our radio stations or websites better, and more often than not, had a plan to implement them that was smoother and more efficient than anything I could have come up with.  Since Mike left us, there hasn't been a day where we haven't discovered something extra he covered that we didn't know about, and our productivity and organization hasn't even started to recover from the loss.  And yeah...I'd hire him again.  Without reservation, hesitation or passing go and collecting $200.  And I'd tell you the same thing if you called me, e-mailed me or hung out with me in a bar.So.  You should really hire Mike.

To say Rob "thinks outside the box" is an understatement.  Rob, bar none, is possibly the best creative mind that I've ever seen or worked with.  He has an uncanny ability to paint such vivid pictures with the imaging work that he does.  It's truly amazing when you get to hear his work, and everyone notices.  I mean, how many stations get requests to play their imaging?

Without a doubt, Lisa is one of the most talented on-air personalities that I've had the pleasure of working with.  I have had a chance to not only work with her during on-air promotions, but also as an on-air colleague.  But since her voiceover career has taken her elsewhere, country radio (and radio in general) in Phoenix isn't quite the same without her!  I'd jump at the chance to work with her again.
